definition: to fight with all one's might

sentences.english: Till you have battled with great grief and fears.
sentences.chinese: 除非你力戰過悲傷與恐懼。

sentences.english: And that means the Addicks have all to play for according to Pardew, starting at Ewood Park next weekend.
sentences.chinese: 這意味着查爾頓將在下週的比賽中力戰布萊克本隊。

sentences.english: After a strange sad war, great war for thee.
sentences.chinese: 爲你經過一場奇怪而慘烈的力戰。

sentences.english: And that day he was slain, fighting by Henry's side.
sentences.chinese: 他當天就在亨利身邊力戰陣亡。

definition: to turn defeat into victory (idiom); to turn the tide
armed enemy of the nation/enemy of the Emperor/fig. championship challenger/contender opposing champion in sporting contest
lit. single spear and horse (idiom); fig. single-handed/unaccompanied
to offer advice/to make a suggestion
to be at the highest level of enlightenment (Buddhist expression)
lit. to ruin the enterprise for the sake of one basketful/to fail through lack of a final effort/to spoil the ship for a ha'penny worth of tar (idiom)
to nurse a grievance/to harbor a grudge
to threaten the east and strike to the west (idiom)/to create a diversion
